ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained basic conversational fluency by the end of L2. I lacked a bit on memorizing characters, but that's my own fault for not keeping up as well. Learned tons of useful vocab and it's crazy how much mandarin I've learned in just a semester.
After taking 110, you continue expanding your Chinese vocabulary and learning grammar rules that will help you converse in the language.
I learned how to speak chinese really well compared to previously. My vocabulary and grammar intuition grew exponentially this semester.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Honestly you can't unplug from this course at any point. The fast pace and active instruction keep you constantly engaged, and you learn a lot in a short amount of time.
The teachers are excellent and are super helpful in helping students learn the language
Strengths: they definitely drill in you the vocabulary and the grammar every day Weaknesses: a lot of work, could be overwhelming for people who don't naturally get the language
Strengths: teaching, rigor, TA sessions, emphasis on pronunciation Weaknesses: Perhaps we could learn a little more about colloquial phrases

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Very intensive but so rewarding. Really made me want to continue learning a language to as close to fluency as I can get, and it motivated me to pursue summer session through Light Fellowship.
Absolutely would recommend. You learn a lot at a quick pace but it's definitely worthwhile.
I'd recommend taking this course to anyone who is willing to spend a good amount of time daily into learning Chinese. You'll definitely learn a lot.
Would definitely recommend this course if you have taken 110 or am a relatively new beginner in Chinese.
I rave about this class. I have recommended it to dozens.
